oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Civil War diary of William Raleigh (or Riley) Clack, Co. B, 43rd Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Company B, 43rd Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA was raised in Sulphur Springs, Rhea County, Tenn. The diary begins on May 23, 1863 about the time that the regiment reported to the defenses of Vicksburg, Mississippi and ends on July 28, 1863. Vicksburg surrendered July 4, 1863 and Clack mentions the surrender in the diary. Paroled with the rest of his regiment after the surrender, Clack took the oath of allegiance in December 1863 and presumably returned home to Rhea County, Tennessee.
